data.title: The FIFA Referees Committee announced the appointment of officials for the Paris 2024 Olympic Games: 02 Moroccan women and not a single man – HIBAPRESS
data.text:
HIBAPRESS-RABAT-FIFA

The FIFA Referees Committee has announced the appointment of match officials from around the world for the upcoming Paris 2024 Olympic Football Tournaments, with notable representation from Africa.

Among the 89 officials selected, 12 are from Africa, demonstrating the continent’s expertise and contribution to the international football scene.

The women’s tournament is scheduled to begin on July 25, 2024 and culminate with the gold medal match at the Parc des Princes in Paris on August 10, 2024.

Likewise, the men’s competition will begin on July 24, 2024, with a final match set for August 9, 2024, also at the Parc des Princes.

These African match officials will undergo rigorous preparation and will continue to benefit from close monitoring and support from a team of FIFA technical trainers, including referees and video assistant referee (VAR) instructors.

Additionally, match analysts, fitness coaches, physiotherapists and sports scientists are on standby to provide officials with advice and support throughout the Olympic Games.

The inclusion of these African match officials highlights the rich talent of the continent’s referees and their desire to officiate on the world stage.

For selected match officials, the Paris 2024 Olympic Football Tournaments represent an important step in their journey towards prestigious events such as the 2026 FIFA World Cup™ and the 2027 FIFA Women’s World Cup™.

African referees at the tournament include BEIDA Dahane of Mauritania, ISMAIL Mahmood Ali M. of Sudan and KARBOUBI Bouchra of Morocco.

Meanwhile, assistant referees from Africa include AHMED Liban Abdoulrazack from Djibouti, CHIKOTESHA Diana from Zambia, JERMOUMI Fatiha from Morocco, NOUPUE Elvis from Cameroon, SANTOS Jerson Emiliano Dos from Angola and YIEMBE Stephen from Kenya.

In the video match officials category, ASHOUR Mahmoud from Egypt and BENBRAHAM Lahlou from Algeria

Additionally, NABADDA Shamirah from Uganda will provide support as a member of the match officials team.

As they prepare to officiate at the Paris 2024 Olympic Football Tournaments, they carry the hopes and aspirations of their nations and their continent to defend fairness and excellence.
